problems.question: If a lens has an object distance \(d_o = 30\,\text{cm}\) and image distance \(d_i = 60\,\text{cm}\), what is its focal length \(f\)?

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: A concave mirror forms a real, inverted image when the object is placed beyond the focal point. Which sign convention indicates a real image distance for mirrors?
problems.hint: Real image distances are taken as positive (in many conventions).
problems.detailed: Using the mirror equation, real images have image distance \(d_i\) positive when the image forms on the same side as the reflected light (following standard sign conventions).

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which formula relates the radius of curvature \(R\) of a spherical mirror to its focal length \(f\)?
problems.hint: Focal length is half radius of curvature.
problems.detailed: For spherical mirrors (and lenses under some conventions), \(f = \frac{R}{2}\).
